segment_text: Of all the problems which have been submitted to my friend, Mr. Sherlock Holmes, for solution during the years of our intimacy, there were only two which I was the means of introducing to his notice—that of Mr. Hatherley’s thumb, and that of Colonel Warburton’s madness.
scene_description: Indoors, writing desk, scattered papers, inkwell.

segment_text: Of these the latter may have afforded a finer field for an acute and original observer, but the other was so strange in its inception and so dramatic in its details that it may be the more worthy of being placed upon record, even if it gave my friend fewer openings for those deductive methods of reasoning by which he achieved such remarkable results.
scene_description: Indoors, writing desk, scattered papers, inkwell.

segment_text: The story has, I believe, been told more than once in the newspapers, but, like all such narratives, its effect is much less striking when set forth _en bloc_ in a single half-column of print than when the facts slowly evolve before your own eyes, and the mystery clears gradually away as each new discovery furnishes a step which leads on to the complete truth.
scene_description: Indoors, writing desk, scattered papers, inkwell.

segment_text: At the time the circumstances made a deep impression upon me, and the lapse of two years has hardly served to weaken the effect.
scene_description: Indoors, writing desk, scattered papers, inkwell.

segment_text: It was in the summer of ’89, not long after my marriage, that the events occurred which I am now about to summarise.
scene_description: London street view, 19th-century buildings, distant train station, daytime.

segment_text: I had returned to civil practice and had finally abandoned Holmes in his Baker Street rooms, although I continually visited him and occasionally even persuaded him to forgo his Bohemian habits so far as to come and visit us.
scene_description: London street view, 19th-century buildings, distant train station, daytime.

segment_text: My practice had steadily increased, and as I happened to live at no very great distance from Paddington Station, I got a few patients from among the officials.
scene_description: London street view, 19th-century buildings, distant train station, daytime.

segment_text: One of these, whom I had cured of a painful and lingering disease, was never weary of advertising my virtues and of endeavouring to send me on every sufferer over whom he might have any influence.
scene_description: London street view, 19th-century buildings, distant train station, daytime.

segment_text: One morning, at a little before seven o’clock, I was awakened by the maid tapping at the door to announce that two men had come from Paddington and were waiting in the consulting-room.
scene_description: Indoors, Victorian consulting room, medical books, desk, early morning light.

segment_text: I dressed hurriedly, for I knew by experience that railway cases were seldom trivial, and hastened downstairs.
scene_description: Indoors, Victorian consulting room, medical books, desk, early morning light.

segment_text: As I descended, my old ally, the guard, came out of the room and closed the door tightly behind him.
scene_description: Indoors, Victorian consulting room, medical books, desk, early morning light.

segment_text: “I’ve got him here,” he whispered, jerking his thumb over his shoulder; “he’s all right.”
scene_description: Indoors, Victorian consulting room, medical books, desk, early morning light.

segment_text: “What is it, then?” I asked, for his manner suggested that it was some strange creature which he had caged up in my room.
scene_description: Indoors, Victorian consulting room, medical books, desk, early morning light.

segment_text: “It’s a new patient,” he whispered.
scene_description: Indoors, Victorian consulting room, medical books, desk, early morning light.

segment_text: “I thought I’d bring him round myself; then he couldn’t slip away. There he is, all safe and sound.
scene_description: Indoors, Victorian consulting room, medical books, desk, early morning light.

segment_text: I must go now, Doctor; I have my dooties, just the same as you.”
scene_description: Indoors, Victorian consulting room, medical books, desk, early morning light.

segment_text: And off he went, this trusty tout, without even giving me time to thank him.
scene_description: Indoors, Victorian consulting room, medical books, desk, early morning light.

segment_text: I entered my consulting-room and found a gentleman seated by the table.
scene_description: Indoors, Victorian consulting room, medical books, desk, early morning light.

segment_text: He was quietly dressed in a suit of heather tweed with a soft cloth cap which he had laid down upon my books.
scene_description: Indoors, Victorian consulting room, medical books, desk, early morning light.

segment_text: Round one of his hands he had a handkerchief wrapped, which was mottled all over with bloodstains.
scene_description: Indoors, Victorian consulting room, medical books, desk, early morning light.

segment_text: He was young, not more than five-and-twenty, I should say, with a strong, masculine face; but he was exceedingly pale and gave me the impression of a man who was suffering from some strong agitation, which it took all his strength of mind to control.
scene_description: Indoors, Victorian consulting room, medical books, desk, early morning light.

segment_text: “I am sorry to knock you up so early, Doctor,” said he, “but I have had a very serious accident during the night.
scene_description: Indoors, Victorian consulting room, medical books, desk, early morning light.

segment_text: I came in by train this morning, and on inquiring at Paddington as to where I might find a doctor, a worthy fellow very kindly escorted me here.
scene_description: Indoors, Victorian consulting room, medical books, desk, early morning light.

segment_text: I gave the maid a card, but I see that she has left it upon the side-table.”
scene_description: Indoors, Victorian consulting room, medical books, desk, early morning light.

segment_text: I took it up and glanced at it.
scene_description: Indoors, Victorian consulting room, medical books, desk, early morning light.

segment_text: “Mr. Victor Hatherley, hydraulic engineer, 16A, Victoria Street (3rd floor).”
scene_description: Indoors, Victorian consulting room, medical books, desk, early morning light.

segment_text: That was the name, style, and abode of my morning visitor.
scene_description: Indoors, Victorian consulting room, medical books, desk, early morning light.

segment_text: “I regret that I have kept you waiting,” said I, sitting down in my library-chair.
scene_description: Indoors, Victorian consulting room, medical books, desk, early morning light.

segment_text: “You are fresh from a night journey, I understand, which is in itself a monotonous occupation.”
scene_description: Indoors, Victorian consulting room, medical books, desk, early morning light.

segment_text: “Oh, my night could not be called monotonous,” said he, and laughed.
scene_description: Indoors, Victorian consulting room, medical books, desk, early morning light.

segment_text: He laughed very heartily, with a high, ringing note, leaning back in his chair and shaking his sides.
scene_description: Indoors, Victorian consulting room, medical books, desk, early morning light.

segment_text: All my medical instincts rose up against that laugh.
scene_description: Indoors, Victorian consulting room, medical books, desk, early morning light.

segment_text: “Stop it!” I cried; “pull yourself together!” and I poured out some water from a caraffe.
scene_description: Indoors, Victorian consulting room, medical books, desk, early morning light.

segment_text: It was useless, however.
scene_description: Indoors, Victorian consulting room, medical books, desk, early morning light.

segment_text: He was off in one of those hysterical outbursts which come upon a strong nature when some great crisis is over and gone.
scene_description: Indoors, Victorian consulting room, medical books, desk, early morning light.

segment_text: Presently he came to himself once more, very weary and pale-looking.
scene_description: Indoors, Victorian consulting room, medical books, desk, early morning light.

segment_text: “I have been making a fool of myself,” he gasped.
scene_description: Indoors, Victorian consulting room, medical books, desk, early morning light.

segment_text: “Not at all. Drink this.”
scene_description: Indoors, Victorian consulting room, medical books, desk, early morning light.

segment_text: I dashed some brandy into the water, and the colour began to come back to his bloodless cheeks.
scene_description: Indoors, Victorian consulting room, medical books, desk, early morning light.

segment_text: “That’s better!” said he.
scene_description: Indoors, Victorian consulting room, medical books, desk, early morning light.

segment_text: “And now, Doctor, perhaps you would kindly attend to my thumb, or rather to the place where my thumb used to be.”
scene_description: Indoors, Victorian consulting room, medical books, desk, early morning light.

segment_text: He unwound the handkerchief and held out his hand.
scene_description: Indoors, Victorian consulting room, medical books, desk, early morning light.

segment_text: It gave even my hardened nerves a shudder to look at it.
scene_description: Indoors, Victorian consulting room, medical books, desk, early morning light.

segment_text: There were four protruding fingers and a horrid red, spongy surface where the thumb should have been.
scene_description: Indoors, Victorian consulting room, medical books, desk, early morning light.

segment_text: It had been hacked or torn right out from the roots.
scene_description: Indoors, Victorian consulting room, medical books, desk, early morning light.

segment_text: “Good heavens!” I cried, “this is a terrible injury. It must have bled considerably.”
scene_description: Indoors, Victorian consulting room, medical books, desk, early morning light.

segment_text: “Yes, it did. I fainted when it was done, and I think that I must have been senseless for a long time.
scene_description: Indoors, Victorian consulting room, medical books, desk, early morning light.

segment_text: When I came to I found that it was still bleeding, so I tied one end of my handkerchief very tightly round the wrist and braced it up with a twig.”
scene_description: Indoors, Victorian consulting room, medical books, desk, early morning light.

segment_text: “Excellent! You should have been a surgeon.”
scene_description: Indoors, Victorian consulting room, medical books, desk, early morning light.

segment_text: “It is a question of hydraulics, you see, and came within my own province.”
scene_description: Indoors, Victorian consulting room, medical books, desk, early morning light.

segment_text: “This has been done,” said I, examining the wound, “by a very heavy and sharp instrument.”
scene_description: Indoors, Victorian consulting room, medical books, desk, early morning light.

segment_text: “A thing like a cleaver,” said he.
scene_description: Indoors, Victorian consulting room, medical books, desk, early morning light.

segment_text: “An accident, I presume?”
scene_description: Indoors, Victorian consulting room, medical books, desk, early morning light.

segment_text: “By no means.”
scene_description: Indoors, Victorian consulting room, medical books, desk, early morning light.

segment_text: “What! a murderous attack?”
scene_description: Indoors, Victorian consulting room, medical books, desk, early morning light.

segment_text: “Very murderous indeed.”
scene_description: Indoors, Victorian consulting room, medical books, desk, early morning light.

segment_text: “You horrify me.”
scene_description: Indoors, Victorian consulting room, medical books, desk, early morning light.

segment_text: I sponged the wound, cleaned it, dressed it, and finally covered it over with cotton wadding and carbolised bandages.
scene_description: Indoors, Victorian consulting room, medical books, desk, early morning light.

segment_text: He lay back without wincing, though he bit his lip from time to time.
scene_description: Indoors, Victorian consulting room, medical books, desk, early morning light.

segment_text: “How is that?” I asked when I had finished.
scene_description: Indoors, Victorian consulting room, medical books, desk, early morning light.

segment_text: “Capital! Between your brandy and your bandage, I feel a new man. I was very weak, but I have had a good deal to go through.”
scene_description: Indoors, Victorian consulting room, medical books, desk, early morning light.

segment_text: “Perhaps you had better not speak of the matter. It is evidently trying to your nerves.”
scene_description: Indoors, Victorian consulting room, medical books, desk, early morning light.

segment_text: “Oh, no, not now. I shall have to tell my tale to the police; but, between ourselves, if it were not for the convincing evidence of this wound of mine, I should be surprised if they believed my statement, for it is a very extraordinary one, and I have not much in the way of proof with which to back it up;
scene_description: Indoors, Victorian consulting room, medical books, desk, early morning light.

segment_text: and, even if they believe me, the clues which I can give them are so vague that it is a question whether justice will be done.”
scene_description: Indoors, Victorian consulting room, medical books, desk, early morning light.

segment_text: “Ha!” cried I, “if it is anything in the nature of a problem which you desire to see solved, I should strongly recommend you to come to my friend, Mr. Sherlock Holmes, before you go to the official police.”
scene_description: Indoors, Victorian consulting room, medical books, desk, early morning light.

segment_text: “Oh, I have heard of that fellow,” answered my visitor, “and I should be very glad if he would take the matter up, though of course I must use the official police as well.
scene_description: Indoors, Victorian consulting room, medical books, desk, early morning light.

segment_text: Would you give me an introduction to him?”
scene_description: Indoors, Victorian consulting room, medical books, desk, early morning light.

segment_text: “I’ll do better. I’ll take you round to him myself.”
scene_description: Indoors, Victorian consulting room, medical books, desk, early morning light.

segment_text: “I should be immensely obliged to you.”
scene_description: Indoors, Victorian consulting room, medical books, desk, early morning light.

segment_text: “We’ll call a cab and go together. We shall just be in time to have a little breakfast with him.
scene_description: Indoors, Victorian consulting room, medical books, desk, early morning light.

segment_text: Do you feel equal to it?”
scene_description: Indoors, Victorian consulting room, medical books, desk, early morning light.

segment_text: “Yes; I shall not feel easy until I have told my story.”
scene_description: Indoors, Victorian consulting room, medical books, desk, early morning light.

segment_text: “Then my servant will call a cab, and I shall be with you in an instant.”
scene_description: Indoors, Victorian consulting room, medical books, desk, early morning light.

segment_text: I rushed upstairs, explained the matter shortly to my wife, and in five minutes was inside a hansom, driving with my new acquaintance to Baker Street.
scene_description: Street view, hansom cab moving, cobblestone street, 19th-century London facades.

segment_text: Sherlock Holmes was, as I expected, lounging about his sitting-room in his dressing-gown, reading the agony column of _The Times_ and smoking his before-breakfast pipe, which was composed of all the plugs and dottles left from his smokes of the day before, all carefully dried and collected on the corner of the mantelpiece.
scene_description: Indoors, cluttered Victorian sitting room, fireplace with pipe paraphernalia, breakfast table.

segment_text: He received us in his quietly genial fashion, ordered fresh rashers and eggs, and joined us in a hearty meal.
scene_description: Indoors, cluttered Victorian sitting room, fireplace with pipe paraphernalia, breakfast table.

segment_text: When it was concluded he settled our new acquaintance upon the sofa, placed a pillow beneath his head, and laid a glass of brandy and water within his reach.
scene_description: Indoors, cluttered Victorian sitting room, fireplace with pipe paraphernalia, breakfast table.

segment_text: “It is easy to see that your experience has been no common one, Mr. Hatherley,” said he.
scene_description: Indoors, cluttered Victorian sitting room, fireplace with pipe paraphernalia, breakfast table.

segment_text: “Pray, lie down there and make yourself absolutely at home. Tell us what you can, but stop when you are tired and keep up your strength with a little stimulant.”
scene_description: Indoors, cluttered Victorian sitting room, fireplace with pipe paraphernalia, breakfast table.

segment_text: “Thank you,” said my patient, “but I have felt another man since the doctor bandaged me, and I think that your breakfast has completed the cure.
scene_description: Indoors, cluttered Victorian sitting room, fireplace with pipe paraphernalia, breakfast table.

segment_text: I shall take up as little of your valuable time as possible, so I shall start at once upon my peculiar experiences.”
scene_description: Indoors, cluttered Victorian sitting room, fireplace with pipe paraphernalia, breakfast table.

segment_text: Holmes sat in his big armchair with the weary, heavy-lidded expression which veiled his keen and eager nature, while I sat opposite to him, and we listened in silence to the strange story which our visitor detailed to us.
scene_description: Indoors, cluttered Victorian sitting room, fireplace with pipe paraphernalia, breakfast table.

segment_text: “You must know,” said he, “that I am an orphan and a bachelor, residing alone in lodgings in London.
scene_description: Indoors, sparse engineer's office, desk, drawing tools, window view of London street.

segment_text: By profession I am a hydraulic engineer, and I have had considerable experience of my work during the seven years that I was apprenticed to Venner & Matheson, the well-known firm, of Greenwich.
scene_description: Indoors, sparse engineer's office, desk, drawing tools, window view of London street.

segment_text: Two years ago, having served my time, and having also come into a fair sum of money through my poor father’s death, I determined to start in business for myself and took professional chambers in Victoria Street.
scene_description: Indoors, sparse engineer's office, desk, drawing tools, window view of London street.

segment_text: “I suppose that everyone finds his first independent start in business a dreary experience. To me it has been exceptionally so.
scene_description: Indoors, sparse engineer's office, desk, drawing tools, window view of London street.

segment_text: During two years I have had three consultations and one small job, and that is absolutely all that my profession has brought me.
scene_description: Indoors, sparse engineer's office, desk, drawing tools, window view of London street.

segment_text: My gross takings amount to £ 27 10_s_.
scene_description: Indoors, sparse engineer's office, desk, drawing tools, window view of London street.

segment_text: Every day, from nine in the morning until four in the afternoon, I waited in my little den, until at last my heart began to sink, and I came to believe that I should never have any practice at all.
scene_description: Indoors, sparse engineer's office, desk, drawing tools, window view of London street.

segment_text: “Yesterday, however, just as I was thinking of leaving the office, my clerk entered to say there was a gentleman waiting who wished to see me upon business.
scene_description: Indoors, sparse engineer's office, desk, drawing tools, window view of London street.

segment_text: He brought up a card, too, with the name of ‘Colonel Lysander Stark’ engraved upon it.
scene_description: Indoors, sparse engineer's office, desk, drawing tools, window view of London street.

segment_text: Close at his heels came the colonel himself, a man rather over the middle size, but of an exceeding thinness.
scene_description: Indoors, sparse engineer's office, desk, drawing tools, window view of London street.

segment_text: I do not think that I have ever seen so thin a man. His whole face sharpened away into nose and chin, and the skin of his cheeks was drawn quite tense over his outstanding bones.
scene_description: Indoors, sparse engineer's office, desk, drawing tools, window view of London street.

segment_text: Yet this emaciation seemed to be his natural habit, and due to no disease, for his eye was bright, his step brisk, and his bearing assured.
scene_description: Indoors, sparse engineer's office, desk, drawing tools, window view of London street.

segment_text: He was plainly but neatly dressed, and his age, I should judge, would be nearer forty than thirty.
scene_description: Indoors, sparse engineer's office, desk, drawing tools, window view of London street.

segment_text: “‘Mr. Hatherley?’ said he, with something of a German accent.
scene_description: Indoors, sparse engineer's office, desk, drawing tools, window view of London street.

segment_text: ‘You have been recommended to me, Mr. Hatherley, as being a man who is not only proficient in his profession but is also discreet and capable of preserving a secret.’
scene_description: Indoors, sparse engineer's office, desk, drawing tools, window view of London street.

segment_text: “I bowed, feeling as flattered as any young man would at such an address.
scene_description: Indoors, sparse engineer's office, desk, drawing tools, window view of London street.

segment_text: ‘May I ask who it was who gave me so good a character?’
scene_description: Indoors, sparse engineer's office, desk, drawing tools, window view of London street.

segment_text: “‘Well, perhaps it is better that I should not tell you that just at this moment. I have it from the same source that you are both an orphan and a bachelor and are residing alone in London.’
scene_description: Indoors, sparse engineer's office, desk, drawing tools, window view of London street.

segment_text: “‘That is quite correct,’ I answered; ‘but you will excuse me if I say that I cannot see how all this bears upon my professional qualifications.
scene_description: Indoors, sparse engineer's office, desk, drawing tools, window view of London street.

segment_text: I understand that it was on a professional matter that you wished to speak to me?’
scene_description: Indoors, sparse engineer's office, desk, drawing tools, window view of London street.

segment_text: “‘Undoubtedly so. But you will find that all I say is really to the point.
scene_description: Indoors, sparse engineer's office, desk, drawing tools, window view of London street.

segment_text: I have a professional commission for you, but absolute secrecy is quite essential—absolute secrecy, you understand, and of course we may expect that more from a man who is alone than from one who lives in the bosom of his family.’
scene_description: Indoors, sparse engineer's office, desk, drawing tools, window view of London street.

segment_text: “‘If I promise to keep a secret,’ said I, ‘you may absolutely depend upon my doing so.’
scene_description: Indoors, sparse engineer's office, desk, drawing tools, window view of London street.

segment_text: “He looked very hard at me as I spoke, and it seemed to me that I had never seen so suspicious and questioning an eye.
scene_description: Indoors, sparse engineer's office, desk, drawing tools, window view of London street.

segment_text: “‘Do you promise, then?’ said he at last.
scene_description: Indoors, sparse engineer's office, desk, drawing tools, window view of London street.

segment_text: “‘Yes, I promise.’
scene_description: Indoors, sparse engineer's office, desk, drawing tools, window view of London street.

segment_text: “‘Absolute and complete silence before, during, and after? No reference to the matter at all, either in word or writing?’
scene_description: Indoors, sparse engineer's office, desk, drawing tools, window view of London street.

segment_text: “‘I have already given you my word.’
scene_description: Indoors, sparse engineer's office, desk, drawing tools, window view of London street.

segment_text: “‘Very good.’ He suddenly sprang up, and darting like lightning across the room he flung open the door.
scene_description: Indoors, sparse engineer's office, desk, drawing tools, window view of London street.

segment_text: The passage outside was empty.
scene_description: Indoors, sparse engineer's office, desk, drawing tools, window view of London street.

segment_text: “‘That’s all right,’ said he, coming back. ‘I know that clerks are sometimes curious as to their master’s affairs. Now we can talk in safety.’
scene_description: Indoors, sparse engineer's office, desk, drawing tools, window view of London street.

segment_text: He drew up his chair very close to mine and began to stare at me again with the same questioning and thoughtful look.
scene_description: Indoors, sparse engineer's office, desk, drawing tools, window view of London street.

segment_text: “A feeling of repulsion, and of something akin to fear had begun to rise within me at the strange antics of this fleshless man.
scene_description: Indoors, sparse engineer's office, desk, drawing tools, window view of London street.

segment_text: Even my dread of losing a client could not restrain me from showing my impatience.
scene_description: Indoors, sparse engineer's office, desk, drawing tools, window view of London street.

segment_text: “‘I beg that you will state your business, sir,’ said I; ‘my time is of value.’
scene_description: Indoors, sparse engineer's office, desk, drawing tools, window view of London street.

segment_text: Heaven forgive me for that last sentence, but the words came to my lips.
scene_description: Indoors, sparse engineer's office, desk, drawing tools, window view of London street.

segment_text: “‘How would fifty guineas for a night’s work suit you?’ he asked.
scene_description: Indoors, sparse engineer's office, desk, drawing tools, window view of London street.

segment_text: “‘Most admirably.’
scene_description: Indoors, sparse engineer's office, desk, drawing tools, window view of London street.

segment_text: “‘I say a night’s work, but an hour’s would be nearer the mark. I simply want your opinion about a hydraulic stamping machine which has got out of gear.
scene_description: Indoors, sparse engineer's office, desk, drawing tools, window view of London street.

segment_text: If you show us what is wrong we shall soon set it right ourselves. What do you think of such a commission as that?’
scene_description: Indoors, sparse engineer's office, desk, drawing tools, window view of London street.

segment_text: “‘The work appears to be light and the pay munificent.’
scene_description: Indoors, sparse engineer's office, desk, drawing tools, window view of London street.

segment_text: “‘Precisely so. We shall want you to come to-night by the last train.’
scene_description: Indoors, sparse engineer's office, desk, drawing tools, window view of London street.

segment_text: “‘Where to?’
scene_description: Indoors, sparse engineer's office, desk, drawing tools, window view of London street.

segment_text: “‘To Eyford, in Berkshire. It is a little place near the borders of Oxfordshire, and within seven miles of Reading.
scene_description: Indoors, sparse engineer's office, desk, drawing tools, window view of London street.

segment_text: There is a train from Paddington which would bring you there at about 11:15.’
scene_description: Indoors, sparse engineer's office, desk, drawing tools, window view of London street.

segment_text: “‘Very good.’
scene_description: Indoors, sparse engineer's office, desk, drawing tools, window view of London street.

segment_text: “‘I shall come down in a carriage to meet you.’
scene_description: Indoors, sparse engineer's office, desk, drawing tools, window view of London street.

segment_text: “‘There is a drive, then?’
scene_description: Indoors, sparse engineer's office, desk, drawing tools, window view of London street.

segment_text: “‘Yes, our little place is quite out in the country. It is a good seven miles from Eyford Station.’
scene_description: Indoors, sparse engineer's office, desk, drawing tools, window view of London street.

segment_text: “‘Then we can hardly get there before midnight. I suppose there would be no chance of a train back. I should be compelled to stop the night.’
scene_description: Indoors, sparse engineer's office, desk, drawing tools, window view of London street.

segment_text: “‘Yes, we could easily give you a shake-down.’
scene_description: Indoors, sparse engineer's office, desk, drawing tools, window view of London street.

segment_text: “‘That is very awkward. Could I not come at some more convenient hour?’
scene_description: Indoors, sparse engineer's office, desk, drawing tools, window view of London street.

segment_text: “‘We have judged it best that you should come late. It is to recompense you for any inconvenience that we are paying to you, a young and unknown man, a fee which would buy an opinion from the very heads of your profession.
scene_description: Indoors, sparse engineer's office, desk, drawing tools, window view of London street.

segment_text: Still, of course, if you would like to draw out of the business, there is plenty of time to do so.’
scene_description: Indoors, sparse engineer's office, desk, drawing tools, window view of London street.

segment_text: “I thought of the fifty guineas, and of how very useful they would be to me.
scene_description: Indoors, sparse engineer's office, desk, drawing tools, window view of London street.

segment_text: ‘Not at all,’ said I, ‘I shall be very happy to accommodate myself to your wishes. I should like, however, to understand a little more clearly what it is that you wish me to do.’
scene_description: Indoors, sparse engineer's office, desk, drawing tools, window view of London street.

segment_text: “‘Quite so. It is very natural that the pledge of secrecy which we have exacted from you should have aroused your curiosity.
scene_description: Indoors, sparse engineer's office, desk, drawing tools, window view of London street.

segment_text: I have no wish to commit you to anything without your having it all laid before you. I suppose that we are absolutely safe from eavesdroppers?’
scene_description: Indoors, sparse engineer's office, desk, drawing tools, window view of London street.

segment_text: “‘Entirely.’
scene_description: Indoors, sparse engineer's office, desk, drawing tools, window view of London street.

segment_text: “‘Then the matter stands thus. You are probably aware that fuller’s-earth is a valuable product, and that it is only found in one or two places in England?’
scene_description: Indoors, sparse engineer's office, desk, drawing tools, window view of London street.

segment_text: “‘I have heard so.’
scene_description: Indoors, sparse engineer's office, desk, drawing tools, window view of London street.

segment_text: “‘Some little time ago I bought a small place—a very small place—within ten miles of Reading.
scene_description: Indoors, sparse engineer's office, desk, drawing tools, window view of London street.

segment_text: I was fortunate enough to discover that there was a deposit of fuller’s-earth in one of my fields. On examining it, however, I found that this deposit was a comparatively small one, and that it formed a link between two very much larger ones upon the right and left—both of them, however, in the grounds of my neighbours.
scene_description: Indoors, sparse engineer's office, desk, drawing tools, window view of London street.

segment_text: These good people were absolutely ignorant that their land contained that which was quite as valuable as a gold-mine.
scene_description: Indoors, sparse engineer's office, desk, drawing tools, window view of London street.

segment_text: Naturally, it was to my interest to buy their land before they discovered its true value, but unfortunately I had no capital by which I could do this.
scene_description: Indoors, sparse engineer's office, desk, drawing tools, window view of London street.

segment_text: I took a few of my friends into the secret, however, and they suggested that we should quietly and secretly work our own little deposit and that in this way we should earn the money which would enable us to buy the neighbouring fields.
scene_description: Indoors, sparse engineer's office, desk, drawing tools, window view of London street.

segment_text: This we have now been doing for some time, and in order to help us in our operations we erected a hydraulic press.
scene_description: Indoors, sparse engineer's office, desk, drawing tools, window view of London street.

segment_text: This press, as I have already explained, has got out of order, and we wish your advice upon the subject.
scene_description: Indoors, sparse engineer's office, desk, drawing tools, window view of London street.

segment_text: We guard our secret very jealously, however, and if it once became known that we had hydraulic engineers coming to our little house, it would soon rouse inquiry, and then, if the facts came out, it would be good-bye to any chance of getting these fields and carrying out our plans.
scene_description: Indoors, sparse engineer's office, desk, drawing tools, window view of London street.

segment_text: That is why I have made you promise me that you will not tell a human being that you are going to Eyford to-night.
scene_description: Indoors, sparse engineer's office, desk, drawing tools, window view of London street.

segment_text: I hope that I make it all plain?’
scene_description: Indoors, sparse engineer's office, desk, drawing tools, window view of London street.

segment_text: “‘I quite follow you,’ said I. ‘The only point which I could not quite understand was what use you could make of a hydraulic press in excavating fuller’s-earth, which, as I understand, is dug out like gravel from a pit.’
scene_description: Indoors, sparse engineer's office, desk, drawing tools, window view of London street.

segment_text: “‘Ah!’ said he carelessly, ‘we have our own process. We compress the earth into bricks, so as to remove them without revealing what they are.
scene_description: Indoors, sparse engineer's office, desk, drawing tools, window view of London street.

segment_text: But that is a mere detail. I have taken you fully into my confidence now, Mr. Hatherley, and I have shown you how I trust you.’
scene_description: Indoors, sparse engineer's office, desk, drawing tools, window view of London street.

segment_text: He rose as he spoke. ‘I shall expect you, then, at Eyford at 11:15.’
scene_description: Indoors, sparse engineer's office, desk, drawing tools, window view of London street.

segment_text: “‘I shall certainly be there.’
scene_description: Indoors, sparse engineer's office, desk, drawing tools, window view of London street.

segment_text: “‘And not a word to a soul.’ He looked at me with a last long, questioning gaze, and then, pressing my hand in a cold, dank grasp, he hurried from the room.
scene_description: Indoors, sparse engineer's office, desk, drawing tools, window view of London street.

segment_text: “Well, when I came to think it all over in cool blood I was very much astonished, as you may both think, at this sudden commission which had been intrusted to me.
scene_description: Indoors, cluttered Victorian sitting room, fireplace with pipe paraphernalia, breakfast table.

segment_text: On the one hand, of course, I was glad, for the fee was at least tenfold what I should have asked had I set a price upon my own services, and it was possible that this order might lead to other ones.
scene_description: Indoors, cluttered Victorian sitting room, fireplace with pipe paraphernalia, breakfast table.

segment_text: On the other hand, the face and manner of my patron had made an unpleasant impression upon me, and I could not think that his explanation of the fuller’s-earth was sufficient to explain the necessity for my coming at midnight, and his extreme anxiety lest I should tell anyone of my errand.
scene_description: Indoors, cluttered Victorian sitting room, fireplace with pipe paraphernalia, breakfast table.

segment_text: However, I threw all fears to the winds, ate a hearty supper, drove to Paddington, and started off, having obeyed to the letter the injunction as to holding my tongue.
scene_description: Outdoors, dim-lit railway platform, station building silhouette, lantern light, nighttime.

segment_text: “At Reading I had to change not only my carriage but my station.
scene_description: Outdoors, dim-lit railway platform, station building silhouette, lantern light, nighttime.

segment_text: However, I was in time for the last train to Eyford, and I reached the little dim-lit station after eleven o’clock.
scene_description: Outdoors, dim-lit railway platform, station building silhouette, lantern light, nighttime.

segment_text: I was the only passenger who got out there, and there was no one upon the platform save a single sleepy porter with a lantern.
scene_description: Outdoors, dim-lit railway platform, station building silhouette, lantern light, nighttime.

segment_text: As I passed out through the wicket gate, however, I found my acquaintance of the morning waiting in the shadow upon the other side.
scene_description: Outdoors, dim-lit railway platform, station building silhouette, lantern light, nighttime.

segment_text: Without a word he grasped my arm and hurried me into a carriage, the door of which was standing open.
scene_description: Carriage interior, frosted glass windows, dark countryside blurs, bumpy ride feel.

segment_text: He drew up the windows on either side, tapped on the wood-work, and away we went as fast as the horse could go.”
scene_description: Carriage interior, frosted glass windows, dark countryside blurs, bumpy ride feel.

segment_text: “One horse?” interjected Holmes.
scene_description: Indoors, cluttered Victorian sitting room, fireplace with pipe paraphernalia, breakfast table.

segment_text: “Yes, only one.”
scene_description: Carriage interior, frosted glass windows, dark countryside blurs, bumpy ride feel.

segment_text: “Did you observe the colour?”
scene_description: Indoors, cluttered Victorian sitting room, fireplace with pipe paraphernalia, breakfast table.

segment_text: “Yes, I saw it by the side-lights when I was stepping into the carriage. It was a chestnut.”
scene_description: Carriage interior, frosted glass windows, dark countryside blurs, bumpy ride feel.

segment_text: “Tired-looking or fresh?”
scene_description: Indoors, cluttered Victorian sitting room, fireplace with pipe paraphernalia, breakfast table.

segment_text: “Oh, fresh and glossy.”
scene_description: Carriage interior, frosted glass windows, dark countryside blurs, bumpy ride feel.

segment_text: “Thank you. I am sorry to have interrupted you. Pray continue your most interesting statement.”
scene_description: Indoors, cluttered Victorian sitting room, fireplace with pipe paraphernalia, breakfast table.

segment_text: “Away we went then, and we drove for at least an hour.
scene_description: Carriage interior, frosted glass windows, dark countryside blurs, bumpy ride feel.

segment_text: Colonel Lysander Stark had said that it was only seven miles, but I should think, from the rate that we seemed to go, and from the time that we took, that it must have been nearer twelve.
scene_description: Carriage interior, frosted glass windows, dark countryside blurs, bumpy ride feel.

segment_text: He sat at my side in silence all the time, and I was aware, more than once when I glanced in his direction, that he was looking at me with great intensity.
scene_description: Carriage interior, frosted glass windows, dark countryside blurs, bumpy ride feel.

segment_text: The country roads seem to be not very good in that part of the world, for we lurched and jolted terribly.
scene_description: Carriage interior, frosted glass windows, dark countryside blurs, bumpy ride feel.

segment_text: I tried to look out of the windows to see something of where we were, but they were made of frosted glass, and I could make out nothing save the occasional bright blur of a passing light.
scene_description: Carriage interior, frosted glass windows, dark countryside blurs, bumpy ride feel.

segment_text: Now and then I hazarded some remark to break the monotony of the journey, but the colonel answered only in monosyllables, and the conversation soon flagged.
scene_description: Carriage interior, frosted glass windows, dark countryside blurs, bumpy ride feel.

segment_text: At last, however, the bumping of the road was exchanged for the crisp smoothness of a gravel-drive, and the carriage came to a stand.
scene_description: Carriage interior, frosted glass windows, dark countryside blurs, bumpy ride feel.

segment_text: Colonel Lysander Stark sprang out, and, as I followed after him, pulled me swiftly into a porch which gaped in front of us.
scene_description: Indoors, dark house porch, heavy wooden door, long shadowy hall, distant lamp glow.

segment_text: We stepped, as it were, right out of the carriage and into the hall, so that I failed to catch the most fleeting glance of the front of the house.
scene_description: Indoors, dark house porch, heavy wooden door, long shadowy hall, distant lamp glow.

segment_text: The instant that I had crossed the threshold the door slammed heavily behind us, and I heard faintly the rattle of the wheels as the carriage drove away.
scene_description: Indoors, dark house porch, heavy wooden door, long shadowy hall, distant lamp glow.

segment_text: “It was pitch dark inside the house, and the colonel fumbled about looking for matches and muttering under his breath.
scene_description: Indoors, dark house porch, heavy wooden door, long shadowy hall, distant lamp glow.

segment_text: Suddenly a door opened at the other end of the passage, and a long, golden bar of light shot out in our direction.
scene_description: Indoors, dark house porch, heavy wooden door, long shadowy hall, distant lamp glow.

segment_text: It grew broader, and a woman appeared with a lamp in her hand, which she held above her head, pushing her face forward and peering at us.
scene_description: Indoors, dark house porch, heavy wooden door, long shadowy hall, distant lamp glow.

segment_text: I could see that she was pretty, and from the gloss with which the light shone upon her dark dress I knew that it was a rich material.
scene_description: Indoors, dark house porch, heavy wooden door, long shadowy hall, distant lamp glow.

segment_text: She spoke a few words in a foreign tongue in a tone as though asking a question, and when my companion answered in a gruff monosyllable she gave such a start that the lamp nearly fell from her hand.
scene_description: Indoors, dark house porch, heavy wooden door, long shadowy hall, distant lamp glow.

segment_text: Colonel Stark went up to her, whispered something in her ear, and then, pushing her back into the room from whence she had come, he walked towards me again with the lamp in his hand.
scene_description: Indoors, dark house porch, heavy wooden door, long shadowy hall, distant lamp glow.

segment_text: “‘Perhaps you will have the kindness to wait in this room for a few minutes,’ said he, throwing open another door.
scene_description: Indoors, plainly furnished room, round table with books, harmonium, barred window shutter, lamplight.

segment_text: It was a quiet, little, plainly furnished room, with a round table in the centre, on which several German books were scattered.
scene_description: Indoors, plainly furnished room, round table with books, harmonium, barred window shutter, lamplight.

segment_text: Colonel Stark laid down the lamp on the top of a harmonium beside the door.
scene_description: Indoors, plainly furnished room, round table with books, harmonium, barred window shutter, lamplight.

segment_text: ‘I shall not keep you waiting an instant,’ said he, and vanished into the darkness.
scene_description: Indoors, plainly furnished room, round table with books, harmonium, barred window shutter, lamplight.

segment_text: “I glanced at the books upon the table, and in spite of my ignorance of German I could see that two of them were treatises on science, the others being volumes of poetry.
scene_description: Indoors, plainly furnished room, round table with books, harmonium, barred window shutter, lamplight.

segment_text: Then I walked across to the window, hoping that I might catch some glimpse of the country-side, but an oak shutter, heavily barred, was folded across it.
scene_description: Indoors, plainly furnished room, round table with books, harmonium, barred window shutter, lamplight.

segment_text: It was a wonderfully silent house. There was an old clock ticking loudly somewhere in the passage, but otherwise everything was deadly still.
scene_description: Indoors, plainly furnished room, round table with books, harmonium, barred window shutter, lamplight.

segment_text: A vague feeling of uneasiness began to steal over me. Who were these German people, and what were they doing living in this strange, out-of-the-way place?
scene_description: Indoors, plainly furnished room, round table with books, harmonium, barred window shutter, lamplight.

segment_text: And where was the place? I was ten miles or so from Eyford, that was all I knew, but whether north, south, east, or west I had no idea.
scene_description: Indoors, plainly furnished room, round table with books, harmonium, barred window shutter, lamplight.

segment_text: For that matter, Reading, and possibly other large towns, were within that radius, so the place might not be so secluded, after all.
scene_description: Indoors, plainly furnished room, round table with books, harmonium, barred window shutter, lamplight.

segment_text: Yet it was quite certain, from the absolute stillness, that we were in the country.
scene_description: Indoors, plainly furnished room, round table with books, harmonium, barred window shutter, lamplight.

segment_text: I paced up and down the room, humming a tune under my breath to keep up my spirits and feeling that I was thoroughly earning my fifty-guinea fee.
scene_description: Indoors, plainly furnished room, round table with books, harmonium, barred window shutter, lamplight.

segment_text: “Suddenly, without any preliminary sound in the midst of the utter stillness, the door of my room swung slowly open.
scene_description: Indoors, plainly furnished room, round table with books, harmonium, barred window shutter, lamplight.

segment_text: The woman was standing in the aperture, the darkness of the hall behind her, the yellow light from my lamp beating upon her eager and beautiful face.
scene_description: Indoors, plainly furnished room, round table with books, harmonium, barred window shutter, lamplight.

segment_text: I could see at a glance that she was sick with fear, and the sight sent a chill to my own heart.
scene_description: Indoors, plainly furnished room, round table with books, harmonium, barred window shutter, lamplight.

segment_text: She held up one shaking finger to warn me to be silent, and she shot a few whispered words of broken English at me, her eyes glancing back, like those of a frightened horse, into the gloom behind her.
scene_description: Indoors, plainly furnished room, round table with books, harmonium, barred window shutter, lamplight.

segment_text: “‘I would go,’ said she, trying hard, as it seemed to me, to speak calmly; ‘I would go.
scene_description: Indoors, plainly furnished room, round table with books, harmonium, barred window shutter, lamplight.

segment_text: I should not stay here. There is no good for you to do.’
scene_description: Indoors, plainly furnished room, round table with books, harmonium, barred window shutter, lamplight.

segment_text: “‘But, madam,’ said I, ‘I have not yet done what I came for. I cannot possibly leave until I have seen the machine.’
scene_description: Indoors, plainly furnished room, round table with books, harmonium, barred window shutter, lamplight.

segment_text: “‘It is not worth your while to wait,’ she went on. ‘You can pass through the door; no one hinders.’
scene_description: Indoors, plainly furnished room, round table with books, harmonium, barred window shutter, lamplight.

segment_text: And then, seeing that I smiled and shook my head, she suddenly threw aside her constraint and made a step forward, with her hands wrung together.
scene_description: Indoors, plainly furnished room, round table with books, harmonium, barred window shutter, lamplight.

segment_text: ‘For the love of Heaven!’ she whispered, ‘get away from here before it is too late!’
scene_description: Indoors, plainly furnished room, round table with books, harmonium, barred window shutter, lamplight.

segment_text: “But I am somewhat headstrong by nature, and the more ready to engage in an affair when there is some obstacle in the way.
scene_description: Indoors, plainly furnished room, round table with books, harmonium, barred window shutter, lamplight.

segment_text: I thought of my fifty-guinea fee, of my wearisome journey, and of the unpleasant night which seemed to be before me.
scene_description: Indoors, plainly furnished room, round table with books, harmonium, barred window shutter, lamplight.

segment_text: Was it all to go for nothing?
scene_description: Indoors, plainly furnished room, round table with books, harmonium, barred window shutter, lamplight.

segment_text: Why should I slink away without having carried out my commission, and without the payment which was my due?
scene_description: Indoors, plainly furnished room, round table with books, harmonium, barred window shutter, lamplight.

segment_text: This woman might, for all I knew, be a monomaniac.
scene_description: Indoors, plainly furnished room, round table with books, harmonium, barred window shutter, lamplight.

segment_text: With a stout bearing, therefore, though her manner had shaken me more than I cared to confess, I still shook my head and declared my intention of remaining where I was.
scene_description: Indoors, plainly furnished room, round table with books, harmonium, barred window shutter, lamplight.

segment_text: She was about to renew her entreaties when a door slammed overhead, and the sound of several footsteps was heard upon the stairs.
scene_description: Indoors, plainly furnished room, round table with books, harmonium, barred window shutter, lamplight.

segment_text: She listened for an instant, threw up her hands with a despairing gesture, and vanished as suddenly and as noiselessly as she had come.
scene_description: Indoors, plainly furnished room, round table with books, harmonium, barred window shutter, lamplight.

segment_text: “The newcomers were Colonel Lysander Stark and a short thick man with a chinchilla beard growing out of the creases of his double chin, who was introduced to me as Mr. Ferguson.
scene_description: Indoors, plainly furnished room, round table with books, harmonium, barred window shutter, lamplight.

segment_text: “‘This is my secretary and manager,’ said the colonel.
scene_description: Indoors, plainly furnished room, round table with books, harmonium, barred window shutter, lamplight.

segment_text: ‘By the way, I was under the impression that I left this door shut just now. I fear that you have felt the draught.’
scene_description: Indoors, plainly furnished room, round table with books, harmonium, barred window shutter, lamplight.

segment_text: “‘On the contrary,’ said I, ‘I opened the door myself because I felt the room to be a little close.’
scene_description: Indoors, plainly furnished room, round table with books, harmonium, barred window shutter, lamplight.

segment_text: “He shot one of his suspicious looks at me.
scene_description: Indoors, plainly furnished room, round table with books, harmonium, barred window shutter, lamplight.

segment_text: ‘Perhaps we had better proceed to business, then,’ said he. ‘Mr. Ferguson and I will take you up to see the machine.’
scene_description: Indoors, plainly furnished room, round table with books, harmonium, barred window shutter, lamplight.

segment_text: “‘I had better put my hat on, I suppose.’
scene_description: Indoors, plainly furnished room, round table with books, harmonium, barred window shutter, lamplight.

segment_text: “‘Oh, no, it is in the house.’
scene_description: Indoors, plainly furnished room, round table with books, harmonium, barred window shutter, lamplight.

segment_text: “‘What, you dig fuller’s-earth in the house?’
scene_description: Indoors, plainly furnished room, round table with books, harmonium, barred window shutter, lamplight.

segment_text: “‘No, no. This is only where we compress it. But never mind that.
scene_description: Indoors, plainly furnished room, round table with books, harmonium, barred window shutter, lamplight.

segment_text: All we wish you to do is to examine the machine and to let us know what is wrong with it.’
scene_description: Indoors, plainly furnished room, round table with books, harmonium, barred window shutter, lamplight.

segment_text: “We went upstairs together, the colonel first with the lamp, the fat manager and I behind him.
scene_description: Indoors, peeling plaster walls, narrow winding staircases, low wooden doors, lamplight.

segment_text: It was a labyrinth of an old house, with corridors, passages, narrow winding staircases, and little low doors, the thresholds of which were hollowed out by the generations who had crossed them.
scene_description: Indoors, peeling plaster walls, narrow winding staircases, low wooden doors, lamplight.

segment_text: There were no carpets and no signs of any furniture above the ground floor, while the plaster was peeling off the walls, and the damp was breaking through in green, unhealthy blotches.
scene_description: Indoors, peeling plaster walls, narrow winding staircases, low wooden doors, lamplight.

segment_text: I tried to put on as unconcerned an air as possible, but I had not forgotten the warnings of the lady, even though I disregarded them, and I kept a keen eye upon my two companions.
scene_description: Indoors, peeling plaster walls, narrow winding staircases, low wooden doors, lamplight.

segment_text: Ferguson appeared to be a morose and silent man, but I could see from the little that he said that he was at least a fellow-countryman.
scene_description: Indoors, peeling plaster walls, narrow winding staircases, low wooden doors, lamplight.

segment_text: “Colonel Lysander Stark stopped at last before a low door, which he unlocked.
scene_description: Indoors, small square room, metal floor, descending piston ceiling, wooden walls, lamplight.

segment_text: Within was a small, square room, in which the three of us could hardly get at one time. Ferguson remained outside, and the colonel ushered me in.
scene_description: Indoors, small square room, metal floor, descending piston ceiling, wooden walls, lamplight.

segment_text: “‘We are now,’ said he, ‘actually within the hydraulic press, and it would be a particularly unpleasant thing for us if anyone were to turn it on.
scene_description: Indoors, small square room, metal floor, descending piston ceiling, wooden walls, lamplight.

segment_text: The ceiling of this small chamber is really the end of the descending piston, and it comes down with the force of many tons upon this metal floor.
scene_description: Indoors, small square room, metal floor, descending piston ceiling, wooden walls, lamplight.

segment_text: There are small lateral columns of water outside which receive the force, and which transmit and multiply it in the manner which is familiar to you.
scene_description: Indoors, small square room, metal floor, descending piston ceiling, wooden walls, lamplight.

segment_text: The machine goes readily enough, but there is some stiffness in the working of it, and it has lost a little of its force.
scene_description: Indoors, small square room, metal floor, descending piston ceiling, wooden walls, lamplight.

segment_text: Perhaps you will have the goodness to look it over and to show us how we can set it right.’
scene_description: Indoors, small square room, metal floor, descending piston ceiling, wooden walls, lamplight.

segment_text: “I took the lamp from him, and I examined the machine very thoroughly.
scene_description: Indoors, small square room, metal floor, descending piston ceiling, wooden walls, lamplight.

segment_text: It was indeed a gigantic one, and capable of exercising enormous pressure.
scene_description: Indoors, small square room, metal floor, descending piston ceiling, wooden walls, lamplight.

segment_text: When I passed outside, however, and pressed down the levers which controlled it, I knew at once by the whishing sound that there was a slight leakage, which allowed a regurgitation of water through one of the side cylinders.
scene_description: Indoors, small square room, metal floor, descending piston ceiling, wooden walls, lamplight.

segment_text: An examination showed that one of the india-rubber bands which was round the head of a driving-rod had shrunk so as not quite to fill the socket along which it worked.
scene_description: Indoors, small square room, metal floor, descending piston ceiling, wooden walls, lamplight.

segment_text: This was clearly the cause of the loss of power, and I pointed it out to my companions, who followed my remarks very carefully and asked several practical questions as to how they should proceed to set it right.
scene_description: Indoors, small square room, metal floor, descending piston ceiling, wooden walls, lamplight.

segment_text: When I had made it clear to them, I returned to the main chamber of the machine and took a good look at it to satisfy my own curiosity.
scene_description: Indoors, small square room, metal floor, descending piston ceiling, wooden walls, lamplight.

segment_text: It was obvious at a glance that the story of the fuller’s-earth was the merest fabrication, for it would be absurd to suppose that so powerful an engine could be designed for so inadequate a purpose.
scene_description: Indoors, small square room, metal floor, descending piston ceiling, wooden walls, lamplight.

segment_text: The walls were of wood, but the floor consisted of a large iron trough, and when I came to examine it I could see a crust of metallic deposit all over it.
scene_description: Indoors, small square room, metal floor, descending piston ceiling, wooden walls, lamplight.

segment_text: I had stooped and was scraping at this to see exactly what it was when I heard a muttered exclamation in German and saw the cadaverous face of the colonel looking down at me.
scene_description: Indoors, small square room, metal floor, descending piston ceiling, wooden walls, lamplight.

segment_text: “‘What are you doing there?’ he asked.
scene_description: Indoors, small square room, metal floor, descending piston ceiling, wooden walls, lamplight.

segment_text: “I felt angry at having been tricked by so elaborate a story as that which he had told me.
scene_description: Indoors, small square room, metal floor, descending piston ceiling, wooden walls, lamplight.

segment_text: ‘I was admiring your fuller’s-earth,’ said I; ‘I think that I should be better able to advise you as to your machine if I knew what the exact purpose was for which it was used.’
scene_description: Indoors, small square room, metal floor, descending piston ceiling, wooden walls, lamplight.

segment_text: “The instant that I uttered the words I regretted the rashness of my speech. His face set hard, and a baleful light sprang up in his grey eyes.
scene_description: Indoors, small square room, metal floor, descending piston ceiling, wooden walls, lamplight.

segment_text: “‘Very well,’ said he, ‘you shall know all about the machine.’
scene_description: Indoors, small square room, metal floor, descending piston ceiling, wooden walls, lamplight.

segment_text: He took a step backward, slammed the little door, and turned the key in the lock.
scene_description: Indoors, small square room, metal floor, descending piston ceiling, wooden walls, lamplight.

segment_text: I rushed towards it and pulled at the handle, but it was quite secure, and did not give in the least to my kicks and shoves.
scene_description: Indoors, small square room, metal floor, descending piston ceiling, wooden walls, lamplight.

segment_text: ‘Hullo!’ I yelled. ‘Hullo! Colonel! Let me out!’
scene_description: Indoors, small square room, metal floor, descending piston ceiling, wooden walls, lamplight.

segment_text: “And then suddenly in the silence I heard a sound which sent my heart into my mouth. It was the clank of the levers and the swish of the leaking cylinder.
scene_description: Indoors, small square room, metal floor, descending piston ceiling, wooden walls, lamplight.

segment_text: He had set the engine at work. The lamp still stood upon the floor where I had placed it when examining the trough.
scene_description: Indoors, small square room, metal floor, descending piston ceiling, wooden walls, lamplight.

segment_text: By its light I saw that the black ceiling was coming down upon me, slowly, jerkily, but, as none knew better than myself, with a force which must within a minute grind me to a shapeless pulp.
scene_description: Indoors, small square room, metal floor, descending piston ceiling, wooden walls, lamplight.

segment_text: I threw myself, screaming, against the door, and dragged with my nails at the lock.
scene_description: Indoors, small square room, metal floor, descending piston ceiling, wooden walls, lamplight.

segment_text: I implored the colonel to let me out, but the remorseless clanking of the levers drowned my cries.
scene_description: Indoors, small square room, metal floor, descending piston ceiling, wooden walls, lamplight.

segment_text: The ceiling was only a foot or two above my head, and with my hand upraised I could feel its hard, rough surface.
scene_description: Indoors, small square room, metal floor, descending piston ceiling, wooden walls, lamplight.

segment_text: Then it flashed through my mind that the pain of my death would depend very much upon the position in which I met it.
scene_description: Indoors, small square room, metal floor, descending piston ceiling, wooden walls, lamplight.

segment_text: If I lay on my face the weight would come upon my spine, and I shuddered to think of that dreadful snap.
scene_description: Indoors, small square room, metal floor, descending piston ceiling, wooden walls, lamplight.

segment_text: Easier the other way, perhaps; and yet, had I the nerve to lie and look up at that deadly black shadow wavering down upon me?
scene_description: Indoors, small square room, metal floor, descending piston ceiling, wooden walls, lamplight.

segment_text: Already I was unable to stand erect, when my eye caught something which brought a gush of hope back to my heart.
scene_description: Indoors, small square room, metal floor, descending piston ceiling, wooden walls, lamplight.

segment_text: “I have said that though the floor and ceiling were of iron, the walls were of wood.
scene_description: Indoors, small square room, metal floor, descending piston ceiling, wooden walls, lamplight.

segment_text: As I gave a last hurried glance around, I saw a thin line of yellow light between two of the boards, which broadened and broadened as a small panel was pushed backward.
scene_description: Indoors, small square room, metal floor, descending piston ceiling, wooden walls, lamplight.

segment_text: For an instant I could hardly believe that here was indeed a door which led away from death.
scene_description: Indoors, small square room, metal floor, descending piston ceiling, wooden walls, lamplight.

segment_text: The next instant I threw myself through, and lay half-fainting upon the other side.
scene_description: Indoors, small square room, metal floor, descending piston ceiling, wooden walls, lamplight.

segment_text: The panel had closed again behind me, but the crash of the lamp, and a few moments afterwards the clang of the two slabs of metal, told me how narrow had been my escape.
scene_description: Indoors, narrow stone corridor, dim candlelight, wooden panel door.

segment_text: “I was recalled to myself by a frantic plucking at my wrist, and I found myself lying upon the stone floor of a narrow corridor, while a woman bent over me and tugged at me with her left hand, while she held a candle in her right.
scene_description: Indoors, narrow stone corridor, dim candlelight, wooden panel door.

segment_text: It was the same good friend whose warning I had so foolishly rejected.
scene_description: Indoors, narrow stone corridor, dim candlelight, wooden panel door.

segment_text: “‘Come! come!’ she cried breathlessly. ‘They will be here in a moment.
scene_description: Indoors, narrow stone corridor, dim candlelight, wooden panel door.

segment_text: They will see that you are not there. Oh, do not waste the so-precious time, but come!’
scene_description: Indoors, narrow stone corridor, dim candlelight, wooden panel door.

segment_text: “This time, at least, I did not scorn her advice. I staggered to my feet and ran with her along the corridor and down a winding stair.
scene_description: Indoors, narrow stone corridor, dim candlelight, wooden panel door.

segment_text: The latter led to another broad passage, and just as we reached it we heard the sound of running feet and the shouting of two voices, one answering the other from the floor on which we were and from the one beneath.
scene_description: Indoors, narrow stone corridor, dim candlelight, wooden panel door.

segment_text: My guide stopped and looked about her like one who is at her wit’s end.
scene_description: Indoors, narrow stone corridor, dim candlelight, wooden panel door.

segment_text: Then she threw open a door which led into a bedroom, through the window of which the moon was shining brightly.
scene_description: Indoors, bedroom, open window, bright moonlight, sparse furnishings.

segment_text: “‘It is your only chance,’ said she. ‘It is high, but it may be that you can jump it.’
scene_description: Indoors, bedroom, open window, bright moonlight, sparse furnishings.

segment_text: “As she spoke a light sprang into view at the further end of the passage, and I saw the lean figure of Colonel Lysander Stark rushing forward with a lantern in one hand and a weapon like a butcher’s cleaver in the other.
scene_description: Indoors, bedroom, open window, bright moonlight, sparse furnishings.

segment_text: I rushed across the bedroom, flung open the window, and looked out.
scene_description: Indoors, bedroom, open window, bright moonlight, sparse furnishings.

segment_text: How quiet and sweet and wholesome the garden looked in the moonlight, and it could not be more than thirty feet down.
scene_description: Indoors, bedroom, open window, bright moonlight, sparse furnishings.

segment_text: I clambered out upon the sill, but I hesitated to jump until I should have heard what passed between my saviour and the ruffian who pursued me.
scene_description: Indoors, bedroom, open window, bright moonlight, sparse furnishings.

segment_text: If she were ill-used, then at any risks I was determined to go back to her assistance.
scene_description: Indoors, bedroom, open window, bright moonlight, sparse furnishings.

segment_text: The thought had hardly flashed through my mind before he was at the door, pushing his way past her; but she threw her arms round him and tried to hold him back.
scene_description: Indoors, bedroom, open window, bright moonlight, sparse furnishings.

segment_text: “‘Fritz! Fritz!’ she cried in English, ‘remember your promise after the last time. You said it should not be again.
scene_description: Indoors, bedroom, open window, bright moonlight, sparse furnishings.

segment_text: He will be silent! Oh, he will be silent!’
scene_description: Indoors, bedroom, open window, bright moonlight, sparse furnishings.

segment_text: “‘You are mad, Elise!’ he shouted, struggling to break away from her. ‘You will be the ruin of us.
scene_description: Indoors, bedroom, open window, bright moonlight, sparse furnishings.

segment_text: He has seen too much. Let me pass, I say!’
scene_description: Indoors, bedroom, open window, bright moonlight, sparse furnishings.

segment_text: He dashed her to one side, and, rushing to the window, cut at me with his heavy weapon.
scene_description: Indoors, bedroom, open window, bright moonlight, sparse furnishings.

segment_text: I had let myself go, and was hanging by the hands to the sill, when his blow fell.
scene_description: Outdoors, moonlit garden, rose bushes, gravel drive, house facade with high window.

segment_text: I was conscious of a dull pain, my grip loosened, and I fell into the garden below.
scene_description: Outdoors, moonlit garden, rose bushes, gravel drive, house facade with high window.

segment_text: “I was shaken but not hurt by the fall; so I picked myself up and rushed off among the bushes as hard as I could run, for I understood that I was far from being out of danger yet.
scene_description: Outdoors, moonlit garden, rose bushes, gravel drive, house facade with high window.

segment_text: Suddenly, however, as I ran, a deadly dizziness and sickness came over me.
scene_description: Outdoors, moonlit garden, rose bushes, gravel drive, house facade with high window.

segment_text: I glanced down at my hand, which was throbbing painfully, and then, for the first time, saw that my thumb had been cut off and that the blood was pouring from my wound.
scene_description: Outdoors, moonlit garden, rose bushes, gravel drive, house facade with high window.

segment_text: I endeavoured to tie my handkerchief round it, but there came a sudden buzzing in my ears, and next moment I fell in a dead faint among the rose-bushes.
scene_description: Outdoors, moonlit garden, rose bushes, gravel drive, house facade with high window.

segment_text: “How long I remained unconscious I cannot tell. It must have been a very long time, for the moon had sunk, and a bright morning was breaking when I came to myself.
scene_description: Outdoors, angle of a hedge, high road nearby, dew-covered plants, early morning light.

segment_text: My clothes were all sodden with dew, and my coat-sleeve was drenched with blood from my wounded thumb.
scene_description: Outdoors, angle of a hedge, high road nearby, dew-covered plants, early morning light.

segment_text: The smarting of it recalled in an instant all the particulars of my night’s adventure, and I sprang to my feet with the feeling that I might hardly yet be safe from my pursuers.
scene_description: Outdoors, angle of a hedge, high road nearby, dew-covered plants, early morning light.

segment_text: But to my astonishment, when I came to look round me, neither house nor garden were to be seen.
scene_description: Outdoors, angle of a hedge, high road nearby, dew-covered plants, early morning light.

segment_text: I had been lying in an angle of the hedge close by the high road, and just a little lower down was a long building, which proved, upon my approaching it, to be the very station at which I had arrived upon the previous night.
scene_description: Outdoors, angle of a hedge, high road nearby, dew-covered plants, early morning light.

segment_text: Were it not for the ugly wound upon my hand, all that had passed during those dreadful hours might have been an evil dream.
scene_description: Outdoors, angle of a hedge, high road nearby, dew-covered plants, early morning light.

segment_text: “Half dazed, I went into the station and asked about the morning train. There would be one to Reading in less than an hour.
scene_description: Outdoors, railway platform, station building silhouette, tracks, bright early morning sky.

segment_text: The same porter was on duty, I found, as had been there when I arrived.
scene_description: Outdoors, railway platform, station building silhouette, tracks, bright early morning sky.

segment_text: I inquired of him whether he had ever heard of Colonel Lysander Stark. The name was strange to him.
scene_description: Outdoors, railway platform, station building silhouette, tracks, bright early morning sky.

segment_text: Had he observed a carriage the night before waiting for me? No, he had not.
scene_description: Outdoors, railway platform, station building silhouette, tracks, bright early morning sky.

segment_text: Was there a police-station anywhere near? There was one about three miles off.
scene_description: Outdoors, railway platform, station building silhouette, tracks, bright early morning sky.

segment_text: “It was too far for me to go, weak and ill as I was. I determined to wait until I got back to town before telling my story to the police.
scene_description: Outdoors, railway platform, station building silhouette, tracks, bright early morning sky.

segment_text: It was a little past six when I arrived, so I went first to have my wound dressed, and then the doctor was kind enough to bring me along here.
scene_description: Indoors, cluttered Victorian sitting room, fireplace, bookshelves, daylight.

segment_text: I put the case into your hands and shall do exactly what you advise.”
scene_description: Indoors, cluttered Victorian sitting room, fireplace, bookshelves, daylight.

segment_text: We both sat in silence for some little time after listening to this extraordinary narrative.
scene_description: Indoors, cluttered Victorian sitting room, fireplace, bookshelves, daylight.

segment_text: Then Sherlock Holmes pulled down from the shelf one of the ponderous commonplace books in which he placed his cuttings.
scene_description: Indoors, cluttered Victorian sitting room, fireplace, bookshelves, daylight.

segment_text: “Here is an advertisement which will interest you,” said he. “It appeared in all the papers about a year ago.
scene_description: Indoors, cluttered Victorian sitting room, fireplace, bookshelves, daylight.

segment_text: Listen to this: ‘Lost, on the 9th inst., Mr. Jeremiah Hayling, aged twenty-six, a hydraulic engineer.
scene_description: Indoors, cluttered Victorian sitting room, fireplace, bookshelves, daylight.

segment_text: Left his lodgings at ten o’clock at night, and has not been heard of since. Was dressed in,’ etc., etc.
scene_description: Indoors, cluttered Victorian sitting room, fireplace, bookshelves, daylight.

segment_text: Ha! That represents the last time that the colonel needed to have his machine overhauled, I fancy.”
scene_description: Indoors, cluttered Victorian sitting room, fireplace, bookshelves, daylight.

segment_text: “Good heavens!” cried my patient. “Then that explains what the girl said.”
scene_description: Indoors, cluttered Victorian sitting room, fireplace, bookshelves, daylight.

segment_text: “Undoubtedly. It is quite clear that the colonel was a cool and desperate man, who was absolutely determined that nothing should stand in the way of his little game, like those out-and-out pirates who will leave no survivor from a captured ship.
scene_description: Indoors, cluttered Victorian sitting room, fireplace, bookshelves, daylight.

segment_text: Well, every moment now is precious, so if you feel equal to it we shall go down to Scotland Yard at once as a preliminary to starting for Eyford.”
scene_description: Indoors, cluttered Victorian sitting room, fireplace, bookshelves, daylight.

segment_text: Some three hours or so afterwards we were all in the train together, bound from Reading to the little Berkshire village.
scene_description: Train interior, window view of passing countryside, upholstered seats, daytime.

segment_text: There were Sherlock Holmes, the hydraulic engineer, Inspector Bradstreet, of Scotland Yard, a plain-clothes man, and myself.
scene_description: Train interior, window view of passing countryside, upholstered seats, daytime.

segment_text: Bradstreet had spread an ordnance map of the county out upon the seat and was busy with his compasses drawing a circle with Eyford for its centre.
scene_description: Train interior, window view of passing countryside, upholstered seats, daytime.

segment_text: “There you are,” said he. “That circle is drawn at a radius of ten miles from the village.
scene_description: Train interior, window view of passing countryside, upholstered seats, daytime.

segment_text: The place we want must be somewhere near that line. You said ten miles, I think, sir.”
scene_description: Train interior, window view of passing countryside, upholstered seats, daytime.

segment_text: “It was an hour’s good drive.”
scene_description: Train interior, window view of passing countryside, upholstered seats, daytime.

segment_text: “And you think that they brought you back all that way when you were unconscious?”
scene_description: Train interior, window view of passing countryside, upholstered seats, daytime.

segment_text: “They must have done so. I have a confused memory, too, of having been lifted and conveyed somewhere.”
scene_description: Train interior, window view of passing countryside, upholstered seats, daytime.

segment_text: “What I cannot understand,” said I, “is why they should have spared you when they found you lying fainting in the garden. Perhaps the villain was softened by the woman’s entreaties.”
scene_description: Train interior, window view of passing countryside, upholstered seats, daytime.

segment_text: “I hardly think that likely. I never saw a more inexorable face in my life.”
scene_description: Train interior, window view of passing countryside, upholstered seats, daytime.

segment_text: “Oh, we shall soon clear up all that,” said Bradstreet. “Well, I have drawn my circle, and I only wish I knew at what point upon it the folk that we are in search of are to be found.”
scene_description: Train interior, window view of passing countryside, upholstered seats, daytime.

segment_text: “I think I could lay my finger on it,” said Holmes quietly.
scene_description: Train interior, window view of passing countryside, upholstered seats, daytime.

segment_text: “Really, now!” cried the inspector, “you have formed your opinion! Come, now, we shall see who agrees with you.
scene_description: Train interior, window view of passing countryside, upholstered seats, daytime.

segment_text: I say it is south, for the country is more deserted there.”
scene_description: Train interior, window view of passing countryside, upholstered seats, daytime.

segment_text: “And I say east,” said my patient.
scene_description: Train interior, window view of passing countryside, upholstered seats, daytime.

segment_text: “I am for west,” remarked the plain-clothes man. “There are several quiet little villages up there.”
scene_description: Train interior, window view of passing countryside, upholstered seats, daytime.

segment_text: “And I am for north,” said I, “because there are no hills there, and our friend says that he did not notice the carriage go up any.”
